definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: At the flower show I thought of that Christmas card.
sentences.chinese: 在花展上我想到了那张圣诞贺卡。

sentences.english: The image, which measures 200x290 micro-meters, features a Christmas tree, and is etched on a tiny piece of glass.
sentences.chinese: 贺卡上圣诞树的图案是在一小块玻璃上蚀刻而成的。

sentences.english: Bo Shi Wa recived some greeting-cards on his birthday.
sentences.chinese: 博士蛙在生日那天收到了一些贺卡。

sentences.english: Now young people prefer to send e-cards for their new year's greeting.
sentences.chinese: 现在年轻人更喜欢发电子贺卡来表达新年祝福。

sentences.english: Interactive game e-card with a retro and dark style.
sentences.chinese: 怀旧设计风格的互动游戏电子贺卡。
谁收到了我的电子贺卡？

sentences.english: You may need to make an envelope to fit this oversized holiday card..
sentences.chinese: 也许你需要做个信封来放这张超大尺寸的节日贺卡。

sentences.english: All these are popular trick-or-treat costumes and decorations for greeting cards and windows.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都是受欢迎的糖果服装和装饰贺卡和窗户。

sentences.english: The rubbings also make an attractive decoration for the front of a holiday greeting card.
sentences.chinese: 拓片也是节日贺卡正面引人注目的装饰品。

sentences.english: Then he sent it to his mother with a birthday card.
sentences.chinese: 然后，他把一张生日贺卡连同那只鸟寄给了他妈。

sentences.english: My card flies through the chilly sky of winter , just to send you smell of sping.
sentences.chinese: 小贺卡穿越寒冷的冬日，只为带给你春日的气息。

sentences.english: And that's half the fun of valentines.
sentences.chinese: 这是瓦伦廷贺卡趣味的一半。

sentences.english: E-cards is much more popular for its convenience and sending speed.
sentences.chinese: 电子贺卡因其便捷而更受欢迎。

sentences.english: It is a good greeting card for Hallowmas.
sentences.chinese: 这是不错的万圣节的贺卡。
